Package AndeA1_2022

Class Deck

java.lang.Object
AndeA1_2022.Deck
public class Deck extends Object
Contains a deck of cards (read an array) This class maintains a list of all available unused cards When a card is removed the list of cards get shorter. You can achieve this by having a int that stores the number of cardsRemaining. You then use this as your end of list value rather than length. This means you don't need to shrink your array

Read the Assignment Class for Assignment Specification
Author:
YOURNAME AND STUDENT ID

    • Deck

      public Deck(boolean random)
      Constructor for the Deck. Adds the following cards to the deck in the following order
      4x Critical Slash, Damage 250, Energy 30 3x Fire Bolt, Damage 175, Energy 50 3x Ice Blast, Damage 150, Energy 50 7x Slash, Damage 125, Energy 30 7x Stab, Damage 100, Energy 30 4x Super Punch, Damage 75, Energy 50 4x Leaping Strike, Damage 50, Energy 40
      4x Healing Aura, Healing 45, Energy 10 4x Healing Potion, Healing 30, Energy 5 10x Weak Punch, Damage 20, Energy 5

      My solution length: 20 line
      Parameters:
      random - . Whether to turn on random features

      Deck [
      
1:Card [name=Critical Slash, energyCost=30, valueDone=250, damage=true]
2:Card [name=Critical Slash, energyCost=30, valueDone=250, damage=true]
3:Card [name=Critical Slash, energyCost=30, valueDone=250, damage=true]

    • getRandomCard

      public Card getRandomCard()
      Uses a random number generator to get a card from the deck somewhere then swaps the last card in the deck to that position and reduces the cardsRemaining by one. This is important. if the random flag is false you should always get the card at position 0. When you swap the card out you should also set the old position to null for safety.

      My solution length: 9 line
      Returns:
      the card drawn or null if no cards left in deck

    • getCardsRemaining

      public int getCardsRemaining()
      Return the number of cards remaining in the deck.

      My solution length: 1 line
      Returns:
      the total cards remaining
